title: Peoria Rivermen 1990s logo
content:
Any help is appreciated!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen shot 2010-04-02 at 8.04.30 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020111902/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202010-04-02%20at%208.04.30%20PM.png) | 48.23 KB |
| [Screen shot 2010-04-03 at 12.09.21 AM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020111902/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20shot%202010-04-03%20at%2012.09.21%20AM.png) | 216.33 KB |
author: JButts

comments.content:
See Nick Curtis's [Emfatick](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020111902/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/emfatick-nf/), a take on Caslon Black Swash. It's not identical, but if you edit off the top left swash on the R, you can see the resemblance. Veer is down at the moment, but Jason Walcott has done some similar revivals. I would guess maybe a mix of swash and regular caps was used for the RIVERMEN logo.

- Mike Yanega
Many thanks to you, good sir.
